description: A dashboard to display data exported by Speedtest Tracker

panels.description: Download speed - measures how quickly you can pull data from a server on the internet to your device.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "download_bits")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Download Speed

panels.description: Upload speed - measures how quickly you send data from your device to the internet.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "upload_bits")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Upload Speed

panels.description: Also called latency, ping is the reaction time of your connection - that is, how quickly your device gets a response after you've sent out a request.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "ping")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Response Time

panels.description:
Also called Packet Delay Variation (PDV), jitter is a measure of the variability in ping over time.
This metric shows the average difference between consecutive latency measurements.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "ping_jitter")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Ping Jitter

panels.description: Packet loss occurs when a packet of data being sent over the internet is not received or is incomplete. This is described in the percentage of packets lost compared to packets sent.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "packet_loss")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Packet Loss

panels.description:
Download speed - measures how quickly you can pull data from a server on the internet to your device.

Upload speed - measures how quickly you send data from your device to the internet.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "download_bits" or r["_field"] == "upload_bits")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Speedtest Results

panels.description: Also called latency, ping is the reaction time of your connection - that is, how quickly your device gets a response after you've sent out a request.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "ping")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Ping

panels.description:
Also called Packet Delay Variation (PDV), jitter is a measure of the variability in ping over time.
This metric shows the average difference between consecutive latency measurements.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "ping_jitter" or r["_field"] == "download_jitter" or r["_field"] == "upload_jitter")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Jitter

panels.description:
Low - Minimum Latency (formerly, Latency) measures the best case latency for the user at the time they decide to take a Speedtest.

Avg - Primary-Server Latency is the interquartile mean (IQM or midmean) of the idle latency tests taken prior to the download portion of a Speedtest.

High - Multi-server latency measures latency to multiple connections and then takes an average.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "upload_latency_avg" or r["_field"] == "upload_latency_high" or r["_field"] == "upload_latency_low")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Upload Latency

panels.description:
Low - Minimum Latency (formerly, Latency) measures the best case latency for the user at the time they decide to take a Speedtest.

Avg - Primary-Server Latency is the interquartile mean (IQM or midmean) of the idle latency tests taken prior to the download portion of a Speedtest.

High - Multi-server latency measures latency to multiple connections and then takes an average.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "download_latency_avg" or r["_field"] == "download_latency_high" or r["_field"] == "download_latency_low")
  |> drop(columns: ["server_host","server_name","server_id"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Download Latency

panels.description: Shows the avg speeds received by server

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "download_bits" or r["_field"] == "id" or r["_field"] == "ping" or r["_field"] == "scheduled" or r["_field"] == "server_host" or r["_field"] == "server_id" or r["_field"] == "server_name" or r["_field"] == "upload_bits" or r["_field"] == "ping_jitter" or r["_field"] == "packet_loss" or r["_field"] == "upload_latency_avg" or r["_field"] == "download_latency_avg")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Avg. Speed by Server

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "speedtest")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "download" or r["_field"] == "download_bits" or r["_field"] == "download_jitter" or r["_field"] == "id" or r["_field"] == "packet_loss" or r["_field"] == "ping" or r["_field"] == "ping_jitter" or r["_field"] == "scheduled" or r["_field"] == "server_host" or r["_field"] == "server_id" or r["_field"] == "server_name" or r["_field"] == "upload" or r["_field"] == "upload_bits" or r["_field"] == "upload_jitter" or r["_field"] == "upload_latency_avg" or r["_field"] == "download_latency_avg")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

title: Speedtest Tracker v2 - InfluxDBv2
